definition: bend/turn/curve
to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
lit. to go on a long detour/fig. to speak vaguely around the topic without getting to the point/to beat about the bush
lit. to go on a long detour/fig. to speak vaguely around the topic without getting to the point/to beat about the bush

sentences.english: Let me be straight with u.
You is this turning curved son to say that I grow it's not good-looking?
sentences.chinese: 你这是拐着弯子说我长得不好看？

sentences.english: Then Snell throws Siri a curveball: "How about downtown?"
sentences.chinese: 然后斯内尔绕起了弯子，“市中心怎么样？”

sentences.english: Mou Anne stomach Fei, your virgin still turns curved son to scold me not good-looking?
sentences.chinese: 牟安腹诽，你闺女还拐着弯子骂我不好看呢？

sentences.english: Make another turn in the dark and come back and eat them.
sentences.chinese: 在黑暗里再绕个弯子，拐回来把它们吃了吧。

sentences.english: That many curved child certainly has not had to circle , the pure spot , I walk my straight profession .
sentences.chinese: 没有那么多弯子一定要绕，单纯点，我走我的直行道。

sentences.english: Dai Yaya home, put down around the bone turn not to ask.
sentences.chinese: 戴亚亚回家，戴骨顺绕了半天弯子没问出个究竟。

sentences.english: He likes to come straight to the point without beating about the bush.
sentences.chinese: 他说话喜欢单刀直入，不绕弯子。

definition: to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
meandering and circuitous (idiom); to go around in circles and never get anywhere
to go for a walk around/fig. to speak in a roundabout way
see 拐彎抹角|拐弯抹角[guai3 wan1 mo4 jiao3]
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
to encircle/to go around/to circle/to beat about the bush
lit. to go on a long detour/fig. to speak vaguely around the topic without getting to the point/to beat about the bush
winding and turning (idiom)
to go for a walk around/fig. to speak in a roundabout way
to turn (a corner etc)/to kidnap/to swindle/to misappropriate/walking stick/crutch/seven (used as a substitute for 七[qi1])
straight talk/straightforward words
(coll.) forthright person
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
to illuminate/to open up (a topic)
going directly (without detour)/(fig.) direct/straightforward (in one's manner or speech)
